languages.custom: the languages it knew in life

description.value:
The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 2d4 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} by the vampire, &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}, or &Reference[restrained]{restrained}. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=necrotic average=true]] damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Regeneration. The vampire regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Spider Climb. The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Vampire Weaknesses. The vampire has the following flaws:

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes [[/damage 20 acid average=false]] damage when it ends its turn in running water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Stake to the Heart. The vampire is destroyed if a &Reference[piercing]{piercing} weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} in its resting place.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes [[/damage 20 radiant average=false]] damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
